result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel P Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Attorney fees paid to Edmund Jelinski included. $250 received by wage assignment applied. Balance to be collected by Agent.

miscConds.notes:
Domestic abuse surcharge imposed. 
Attorney fees paid to Edmund Jelinski included. $250 received by wage assignment applied. Balance to be collected by Agent.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

Defendant Daniel P Wilson in court with attorney Edmund Jelinski.  
Danuta E. Kurczewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
17CM120 - Defendant enters a plea of no contest to the sole count in the Complaint. 
Plea accepted and defendant found guilty. 
Defendant sentenced to time served and costs. 
16CM73 - Defendant enters a plea of no contest to the sole count in the Complaint. 
Plea accepted and defendant found guilty. 
16CM258 - Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 2 of the Complaint. 
Plea accepted and defendant found guilty of Count 2. 
Count 3 is dismissed and read in. 
16CM350 - Both counts in this case are dismissed and read in. 
16CM73/16CM258 - sentence withheld, ordered 2 years Probation, concurrent each count, each case. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations
